rounds.category: INITIALS FROM GREEK GOD TO ROMAN GOD
rounds.comments: (Ken: And here we'll need both names.)

clues.text:
E to C:
As mommy, Aphrodite was out & Venus was in for these 2 li'l guys

H to M:
When the gods absolutely, positively needed something delivered overnight (or sooner!), they were the dudes to call

D to B:
With these 2, come for fruitfulness & vegetation, but stay for the wine & ecstasy

H to J:
These chief goddesses had their jealous moments in both civilizations

A to M:
A word to the wise--they were equal opportunity as war goddesses
Hannah Arendt compared totalitarianism to this bulb vegetable, with a central leader wrapped in layers of followers
The idea that the political spectrum is an arc with far right & far left bending toward each other is this lucky symbol theory
Texas Sen. Lloyd Bentsen gets credit for coining this term for an organized effort to fake a grassroots movement
This judicial "-ism" holds that the text of the Constitution is "not living but dead"--fixed in the meaning it had when written
It's the 3-word doctrine that the individual branches of government are distinct & shall not infringe on the others' authority

rounds.comments: (Ken: Hope you're not tired of those yet.)

clues.text: "Have" this rhyming type of "Christmas; it's the best time of the year"
"Born is the king of Israel", this song tells us
"It's Christmas time in the city, ring-a-ling (ring-a-ling), hear them ring, (ting-a-ling) "--these
Singing along with Bing, The Andrews Sisters tell us of this second day of Christmas gift
"Chestnuts roasting on an open fire," this personage "nipping at your nose"

Located somewhere in the Rockies, the Capitol of this country dominates its 12 surrounding districts
George Lucas said of this "Return of the Jedi" guy, "Richard M. Nixon was his name. He subverted the Senate & finally took over"
Secretary of Education Laura Roslin suddenly ascends to the presidency of the 12 Colonies on this series
This "Star Trek" organization, the UFP for short, has a president, a Federal Council & a Supreme Court
A prominent member of the Ape National Assembly, this doctor is both Minister of Science & Chief Defender of the Faith
The Victorians loved these supernatural little creatures, often spelled with an "E" in place of an "I", as in Yeats' "The Stolen Child"
In this poem, Tennyson wrote, "When can their glory fade? O the wild charge they made! All the world wondered"
Thomas Hardy really liked this made-up name, writing a poem about its "Captains" as well as a novel about its "Mayor"
His "Barrack Room Ballads" covers India & beyond, as in "Ford o' Kabul River"
Thackeray wrote that this 1851 London exhibition hall "stands in High Park like Noah's Ark, a rainbow bint above it"
By him in 1705: "A Synopsis of the Astronomy of Comets"
2024 breaking news: "Evidence of Dark" (not photosynthetic) this element "Production at the Abyssal Seafloor"
2012: "Tidal Heating Shrinks" this adorably named not-too-cold, not-too-hot "Zone"

2012:
"Observation of a New Particle in the Search for the Standard Model" this particle "with the Atlas Detector at the LHC"
2021: "The Soundscape of the" this proposed human-dominated epoch "Ocean"
An ever-questioning monkey of literature asks how he became the actor who won an Oscar for "Syriana"
Winter underwear worn at the university where the Peabody Institute is located
A proverbial admonition not to weep over mishandled dairy that turned into a caramel-&-chocolate Hershey product
clues.response: don't cry over spilled Milk Duds

clues.text: A phrase about a photo's value equivalent to a certain amount of prose gets into a Scrabble-like online game founded in 2009
clues.response: a picture's worth a thousand Words with Friends

clues.text: A 1981 "meal" movie with Wallace Shawn tags in a huge pro wrestling legend & a co-star of Shawn's in a film 6 years later
A fantasy romance series by Sarah J. Maas kicks off with "A Court of Thorns &" these flowers
David Lagercrantz took over from this Swedish author, writing about Lisbeth Salander in "The Girl in the Spider's Web"
In the movie adaptation, Cate Blanchett played the title Ms. Fox, who goes missing before a family trip in "Where'd You Go" her
His novels "Dear John" & "The Longest Ride" were made into films
Use "The Power of Now" to name this German-born author of "The Power of Now"

rounds.comments: (Ken: Each response is two words that differ only by the one swapped letter.)

In 1875, due to waning interest, the All England Croquet Club offered this other lawn sport as an added attraction
Walter Camp, captain of this Connecticut school's football team in the 1870s, introduced the QB position & 11-man teams
This pitcher for whom an award is named pitched his first game with the Cleveland Spiders in 1890, winning 267 games through 1899
In 1859 British tea planters in Assam, India formed the first European club for this equestrian sport
The first running of this stakes race was in 1867 at Jerome Park in New York's Westchester County; a filly named Ruthless won
Founded in 1863, this international organization won its first of 3 Nobel Peace Prizes in 1917
Scotland's James II, who sided with Lancaster vs. York in these 15th c. wars, died when one of his own cannons blew up beside him
Milton Obote returned as president of Uganda after the overthrow of this man in 1979
After Alexander's death, one of his generals began this Egyptian dynasty that lasted about 300 years until Cleopatra's death
Alberto Fujimori, a controversial former leader of this nation, passed away in 2024 & was buried after 3 days of national mourning

rounds.text: After leaving a religious group, John & Arlyn Bottom changed their family's last name to this, to signify a rebirth
